Puli’s documentation!¶

octopus.worker.worker¶

class octopus.worker.worker.Worker(framework)[source]¶
modifiedCommandWatchers None[source]¶

an iterable list of the modified command watchers

Return type:list of CommandWatcher
pauseWorker(paused, killproc)[source]¶

Called from mainloop when checking killfile presence (also checked when registering). Send a request to the dispatcher to update rendernode’s state. req: PUT /rendernodes/<currentRN>/paused/

registerWorker()[source]¶

Register the worker in the dispatcher.

reloadConfig()[source]¶

This function translates foo into bar

Parameters:foo – A string to be converted
Returns:A bar formatted string
sendSysInfosMessage()[source]¶

Send sys infos to the dispatcher, the request content holds the RN status only, it has to be kept very small to avoid nerwork flood. req: PUT /rendernodes/<currentRN>/sysinfos

updateCommandWatcher(commandWatcher)[source]¶

Send info to the dispatcher about currently running command watcher. Called from the mainloop every time a command has been tagged “modified” req: PUT /rendernodes/<currentRN>/commands/<commandId>/

class octopus.worker.workerwebservice.RamInUseResource(application, request, **kwargs)[source]¶

TO FIX: the method for retrieving mem used is not really correct. We should use “free -m” or directly /proc/meminfo -> use = memtotal - (memfree + membuffer + memcache)

class octopus.worker.workerwebservice.WorkerWebService(framework, port)[source]¶

A tornado application that will communicate with the dispatcher via webservices Services are:

/commands /commands/<id command> /log /log/command/<path> /updatesysinfos /pause /ramInUse /reconfig

octopus.worker.process¶

Used by Worker to spawn a new process.

octopus.worker.process.spawnCommandWatcher(pidfile, logfile, args, env)[source]¶

logfile is a file object

tools.common¶

Utility classes and static methods used in every tools

class tools.common.ConstraintFactory[source]¶

Can parse arguments and options received as command line and create a proper http query string.

static makeQuery(pUserArguments, pUserOptions)[source]¶

Parse arguments and options to create a proper http query string: “constraint_user=jsa&constraint_id=152” With command line args and options: “–constraint user=jsa -c id=152 -c id=156 -c id=188” We create a useful query: “&constraint_user=jsa&constraint_id=152&constraint_id=156&constraint_id=188”

Parameters:
  • pUserArguments – A list of strings representing user arguments
  • pUserOptions – A dic of strings representing user options
Returns:

A string query or none if a constraint or update is not valid.
